00001 # Name:    multicursor.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/15/2013
00004 # Brief:   Namespace to handle cases where multiple cursor support is needed.
00005 
00006 namespace eval multicursor {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009     
00010   variable selected            0
00011   variable select_start_line   ""
00012   variable select_start_column ""
00013   variable cursor_anchor       ""
00014   
00015   array set copy_cursors {}
00016    
00017   ######################################################################
00018   # Adds bindings for multicursor support to the supplied text widget.
00019   proc add_bindings {txt} {
00020       
00021     # Create tag for the multicursor stuff
00022     $txt tag configure mcursor -underline 1
00023 
00024     # Create multicursor bindings
00025     bind mcursor$txt <<Selection>>               "[ns multicursor]::handle_selection %W"
00026     bind mcursor$txt <Alt-Button-1>              "[ns multicursor]::handle_alt_button1 %W %x %y"
00027     bind mcursor$txt <Alt-Button-3>              "[ns multicursor]::handle_alt_button3 %W %x %y"
00028     bind mcursor$txt <Shift-Alt-ButtonPress-1>   "[ns multicursor]::handle_shift_alt_buttonpress1 %W %x %y; break"
00029     bind mcursor$txt <Shift-Alt-B1-Motion>       "[ns multicursor]::handle_shift_alt_motion %W %x %y; break"
00030     bind mcursor$txt <Shift-Alt-ButtonRelease-1> "[ns multicursor]::handle_shift_alt_buttonrelease1 %W %x %y; break"
00031     bind mcursor$txt <Key-Delete>                "if {\[[ns multicursor]::handle_delete %W\]} { break }"
00032     bind mcursor$txt <Key-BackSpace>             "if {\[[ns multicursor]::handle_backspace %W\]} { break }"
00033     bind mcursor$txt <Return>                    "if {\[[ns multicursor]::handle_return %W\]} { break }"
00034     bind mcursor$txt <Any-KeyPress>              "if {\[[ns multicursor]::handle_keypress %W %A %K\]} { break }"
00035     bind mcursor$txt <Escape>                    "[ns multicursor]::handle_escape %W"
00036     bind mcursor$txt <Button-1>                  "[ns multicursor]::disable %W"
00037     
00038     # Add the multicursor bindings to the text widget's bindtags
00039     bindtags $txt.t [linsert [bindtags $txt.t] 2 mcursor$txt]
00040 
00041   }
00042   
00043   ######################################################################
00044   # Handles a selection of the widget in the multicursor mode.
00045   proc handle_selection {W} {
00046     
00047     variable selected
00048     
00049     set selected 0
00050     
00051     if {[llength [set sel [$W tag ranges sel]]] > 2} {
00052       set selected 1
00053       $W tag remove mcursor 1.0 end
00054       set i 0
00055       foreach {start end} $sel {
00056         $W tag add mcursor $start $end
00057         incr i
00058       }
00059     }
00060     
00061   }
00062   
00063   ######################################################################
00064   # Handles an Alt-Button-1 event when in multicursor mode.
00065   proc handle_alt_button1 {W x y} {
00066 
00067     add_cursor $W [$W index @$x,$y]
00068     
00069   }
00070   
00071   ######################################################################
00072   # Handles an Alt-Button-3 event when in multicursor mode.
00073   proc handle_alt_button3 {W x y} {
00074     
00075     add_cursors $W [$W index @$x,$y]
00076     
00077   }
00078   
00079   ######################################################################
00080   # Handles a Shift-Alt-Buttonpress-1 event when in multicursor mode.
00081   proc handle_shift_alt_buttonpress1 {W x y} {
00082     
00083     variable select_start_line
00084     variable select_start_column
00085     
00086     lassign [split [$W index @$x,$y] .] select_start_line select_start_column
00087     $W tag remove sel 1.0 end
00088     
00089   }
00090   
00091   ######################################################################
00092   # Handles a Shift-Alt-Button1-Motion event when in multicursor mode.
00093   proc handle_shift_alt_motion {W x y} {
00094     
00095     variable select_start_line
00096     variable select_start_column
00097     
00098     lassign [split [$W index @$x,$y] .] line column
00099     lassign [split [lindex [$W tag ranges sel] end] .] last_line last_column
00100     
00101     if {($last_line eq "") || ($line != $last_line) || ($column != $last_column)} {
00102       $W tag remove sel 1.0 end
00103       for {set i $select_start_line} {$i <= $line} {incr i} {
00104         $W tag add sel $i.$select_start_column $i.$column
00105       }
00106     }
00107     
00108   }
00109   
00110   ######################################################################
00111   # Handles a Shift-Alt-Buttonrelease-1 event when in multicursor mode.
00112   proc handle_shift_alt_buttonrelease1 {W x y} {
00113     
00114     variable select_start_line
00115     variable select_start_column
00116     
00117     set select_start_line   ""
00118     set select_start_column ""
00119       
00120   }
00121   
00122   ######################################################################
00123   # Handles a delete key event in multicursor mode.
00124   proc handle_delete {W} {
00125     
00126     if {![[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $W] && [[ns multicursor]::delete $W "+1c"]} {
00127       return 1
00128     }
00129     
00130     return 0
00131     
00132   }
00133   
00134   ######################################################################
00135   # Handles a backspace key event in multicursor mode.
00136   proc handle_backspace {W} {
00137     
00138     if {![[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $W] && [[ns multicursor]::delete $W "-1c"]} {
00139       return 1
00140     }
00141     
00142     return 0
00143     
00144   }
00145   
00146   ######################################################################
00147   # Handles a return key event in multicursor mode.
00148   proc handle_return {W} {
00149     
00150     if {![[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $W] && [[ns multicursor]::insert $W "\n" [ns indent]::newline]} {
00151       return 1
00152     }
00153     
00154     return 0
00155     
00156   }
00157   
00158   ######################################################################
00159   # Handles a keypress event in multicursor mode.
00160   proc handle_keypress {W A K} {
00161     
00162     if {([string compare -length 5 $K "Shift"]   != 0) && \
00163         ([string compare -length 7 $K "Control"] != 0) && \
00164         ![[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $W]} {
00165       if {[string length $A] == 0} {
00166         [ns multicursor]::disable $W
00167       } elseif {[string is print $A] && [[ns multicursor]::insert $W $A [ns indent]::check_indent]} {
00168         return 1
00169       }
00170     }
00171     
00172     return 0
00173     
00174   }
00175   
00176   ######################################################################
00177   # Handles an escape event in multicursor mode.
00178   proc handle_escape {W} {
00179     
00180     if {[[ns vim]::get_edit_mode $W] eq ""} {
00181       disable $W
00182     }
00183     
00184   }
00185   
00186   ######################################################################
00187   # Returns 1 if multiple selections exist; otherwise, returns 0.
00188   proc enabled {txt} {
00189       
00190     return [expr [llength [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] > 0]
00191         
00192   }
00193   
00194   ######################################################################
00195   # Disables the multicursor mode for the given text widget.
00196   proc disable {txt} {
00197     
00198     variable cursor_anchor
00199     
00200     # Clear the start positions value
00201     $txt tag remove mcursor 1.0 end
00202 
00203     # Clear the current anchor
00204     set cursor_anchor ""
00205   
00206   }
00207   
00208   ######################################################################
00209   # Set a multicursor at the given index.
00210   proc add_cursor {txt index} {
00211     
00212     variable cursor_anchor
00213     
00214     if {[$txt index "$index lineend"] eq $index} {
00215       $txt insert $index " "
00216     }
00217     
00218     if {[llength [set mcursors [lsearch -inline [$txt tag names $index] mcursor*]]] == 0} {
00219       $txt tag add mcursor $index
00220     } else {
00221       $txt tag remove mcursor $index
00222     }
00223     
00224     # Set the cursor anchor to the current index
00225     set cursor_anchor $index
00226       
00227   }
00228   
00229   ######################################################################
00230   # Set multicursors between the anchor and the current line.
00231   proc add_cursors {txt index} {
00232     
00233     variable cursor_anchor
00234     
00235     if {$cursor_anchor ne ""} {
00236       
00237       # Get the anchor line and column
00238       lassign [split [set orig_anchor $cursor_anchor] .] row col
00239       
00240       # Get the current row
00241       set curr_row [lindex [split $index .] 0]
00242       
00243       # Set the cursor
00244       if {$row < $curr_row} {
00245         for {set i [expr $row + 1]} {$i <= $curr_row} {incr i} {
00246           add_cursor $txt $i.$col
00247         }
00248       } else {
00249         for {set i $curr_row} {$i < $row} {incr i} {
00250           add_cursor $txt $i.$col
00251         }
00252       }
00253       
00254       # Re-set the cursor anchor
00255       set cursor_anchor $orig_anchor
00256       
00257     }
00258     
00259   }
00260   
00261   ######################################################################
00262   # Searches for any string matches in the from/to range that match the
00263   # regular expression "exp".  Whenever a match is found, the first
00264   # character in the match is added to the current cursor list.
00265   proc search_and_add_cursors {txt from to exp} {
00266     
00267     foreach index [$txt search -regexp -all $exp $from $to] {
00268       add_cursor $txt $index
00269     }
00270     
00271   }
00272   
00273   ######################################################################
00274   # Adjusts the cursors by the given suffix.  The valid values for suffix
00275   # are:
00276   #  +1c - Adjusts the cursors one character to the right.
00277   #  -1c - Adjusts the cursors one character to the left.
00278   #  +1l - Adjusts the cursors one line down.
00279   #  -1l - Adjusts the cursors one line up.
00280   #
00281   # If the insert value is set to 1 and moving the character would cause
00282   # the cursor to be lost (beginning/end of line or beginning/end of file),
00283   # a line or character will be inserted and the cursor set to that position.
00284   # The inserted text will be given the tag name of "insert_tag".
00285   proc adjust {txt suffix {insert 0} {insert_tag ""}} {
00286     
00287     if {[string index $suffix 0] eq "+"} {
00288       
00289       # If any of the cursors would "fall off the edge", don't modify any of them
00290       if {!$insert && ([string index $suffix end] eq "c")} {
00291         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00292           if {[$txt compare $start == "$start lineend-1c"]} {
00293             return
00294           }
00295         }
00296       }
00297       
00298       # Move the cursors
00299       foreach {end start} [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] {
00300         $txt tag remove mcursor $start
00301         switch $suffix {
00302           "+1c" {
00303             if {[$txt compare $start == "$start lineend-1c"]} {
00304               if {$insert} {
00305                 $txt insert "$start+1c" " "
00306                 if {$insert_tag ne ""} {
00307                   $txt tag add $insert_tag "$start+1c"
00308                 }
00309                 $txt tag add mcursor "$start+1c"
00310               } else {
00311                 $txt tag add mcursor $start
00312                 break
00313               }
00314             } else {
00315               $txt tag add mcursor "$start+1c"
00316             }
00317           }
00318           "+1l" {
00319             if {$insert} {
00320               $txt insert "$start lineend" "\n "
00321               if {$insert_tag ne ""} {
00322                 $txt tag add $insert_tag "$start+1l linestart"
00323               }
00324               $txt tag add mcursor "$start+1l linestart"
00325             } elseif {[$txt compare $start < "end-1l"]} {
00326               $txt tag add mcursor "$start+1l"
00327             } else {
00328               $txt tag add mcursor $start
00329               break
00330             }
00331           }
00332         }
00333       }
00334       
00335     } else {
00336       
00337       # If any of the cursors would "fall off the edge", don't adjust any of them
00338       if {!$insert && ([string index $suffix end] eq "c")} {
00339         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00340           if {[$txt compare $start == "$start linestart"]} {
00341             return
00342           }
00343         }
00344       }
00345       
00346       # Adjust the cursors
00347       foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00348         $txt tag remove mcursor $start
00349         switch $suffix {
00350           "-1c" {
00351             if {[$txt compare $start == "$start linestart"]} {
00352               if {$insert} {
00353                 $txt insert $start " "
00354                 if {$insert_tag ne ""} {
00355                   $txt tag add $insert_tag $start
00356                 }
00357                 $txt tag add mcursor $start
00358               } else {
00359                 $txt tag add mcursor $start
00360                 break
00361               }
00362             } else {
00363               $txt tag add mcursor "$start-1c"
00364             }
00365           }
00366           "-1l" {
00367             if {$insert} {
00368               $txt insert "$start linestart" " \n"
00369               if {$insert_tag ne ""} {
00370                 $txt tag add $insert_tag "$start linestart"
00371               }
00372               $txt tag add mcursor "$start linestart"
00373             } elseif {[$txt compare $start >= 2.0]} {
00374               $txt tag add mcursor "$start-1l"
00375             } else {
00376               $txt tag add mcursor $start
00377               break
00378             }
00379           }
00380         }
00381       }
00382       
00383     }
00384     
00385   }
00386   
00387   ######################################################################
00388   # Handles the deletion key.  The value of suffix defines what text will
00389   # be deleted.  The following is a listing of valid values for suffix:
00390   # - selected  = Forces selected text to be deleted (by default this is detected)
00391   # - line      = Delete the entire line of the current cursor.
00392   # - word      = Delete the number of words from the current cursor.
00393   # - linestart = Delete the line from the start to the current cursor.
00394   # - lineend   = Delete the line from the current cursor to the end of the line.
00395   # - -#type    = Delete # of types prior to the cursor to the cursor.
00396   # - +#type    = Delete from the cursor to # of types after the cursor.
00397   proc delete {txt suffix {num 1}} {
00398     
00399     variable selected
00400     
00401     # Only perform this if multiple cursors
00402     if {[enabled $txt]} {
00403       if {$selected || ($suffix eq "selected")} {
00404         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00405           $txt delete $start $end
00406           $txt tag add mcursor $start
00407         }
00408         set selected 0
00409       } elseif {$suffix eq "line"} {
00410         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00411           $txt delete "$start linestart" "$start lineend"
00412           $txt tag add mcursor "$start linestart"
00413         }
00414       } elseif {$suffix eq "word"} {
00415         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00416           $txt delete $start "[[ns vim]::get_word $txt next [expr $num - 1] $start] wordend"
00417           $txt tag add mcursor $start
00418         }
00419       } elseif {$suffix eq "linestart"} {
00420         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00421           $txt delete "$start linestart" $start
00422           $txt tag add mcursor "$start linestart"
00423         }
00424       } elseif {$suffix eq "lineend"} {
00425         foreach {end start} [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] {
00426           $txt delete $start "$start lineend"
00427           if {[$txt compare $start > "$start linestart"]} {
00428             $txt tag add mcursor "$start-1c"
00429           }
00430         }
00431       } elseif {[string index $suffix 0] eq "-"} {
00432         foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00433           if {[$txt compare "$start$suffix" < "$start linestart"]} {
00434             $txt delete "$start linestart" $start
00435             $txt tag add mcursor "$start$suffix"
00436           } else {
00437             $txt delete "$start$suffix" $start
00438             $txt tag add mcursor "$start$suffix"
00439           }
00440         }
00441       } else {
00442         foreach {end start} [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] {
00443           if {[$txt compare "$start$suffix" >= "$start lineend"]} {
00444             $txt delete $start "$start lineend"
00445             $txt tag add mcursor "$start-1c"
00446           } else {
00447             $txt delete $start "$start$suffix"
00448             $txt tag add mcursor $start
00449           }
00450         }
00451       }
00452       return 1
00453     }
00454     
00455     return 0
00456     
00457   }
00458   
00459   ######################################################################
00460   # Handles the insertion of a printable character.
00461   proc insert {txt value {indent_cmd ""}} {
00462     
00463     variable selected
00464 
00465     # Insert the value into the text widget for each of the starting positions
00466     if {[enabled $txt]} {
00467       if {$selected} {
00468         foreach {end start} [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] {
00469           $txt delete $start $end
00470           $txt tag add mcursor $start
00471         }
00472         set selected 0
00473       }
00474       foreach {end start} [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] {
00475         $txt insert $start $value
00476         if {$indent_cmd ne ""} {
00477           $indent_cmd $txt [$txt index $start+1c]
00478         }
00479       }
00480       return 1
00481     }
00482     
00483     return 0
00484   
00485   }
00486   
00487   ######################################################################
00488   # Handle the replacement of a given character.
00489   proc replace {txt value {indent_cmd ""}} {
00490     
00491     variable selected
00492     
00493     # Replace the current insertion cursor with the given value
00494     if {[enabled $txt]} {
00495       if {$selected} {
00496         return [insert $txt $value $indent_cmd]
00497       } else {
00498         foreach {end start} [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]] {
00499           $txt replace $start "$start+1c" $value
00500           $txt tag add mcursor "$start+1c"
00501           $txt highlight "$start linestart" "$start lineend"
00502           if {$indent_cmd ne ""} {
00503             $indent_cmd $txt [$txt index "$start+1c"]
00504           }
00505         }
00506         return 1
00507       }
00508     }
00509     
00510     return 0
00511     
00512   }
00513   
00514   ######################################################################
00515   # Parses the given number string with the format of:
00516   #   (d|o|x)?<number>+
00517   # Where d means to parse and insert decimal numbers, o means to parse
00518   # and insert octal numbers, and x means to parse and insert hexidecimal
00519   # numbers.  If d, o or x are not specified, d is assumed.
00520   # Numbers will be inserted at each cursor location such that the first
00521   # cursor will be replaced with the number specified by <number>+ and
00522   # each successive cursor will have an incrementing value inserted
00523   # at its location.
00524   proc insert_numbers {txt numstr} {
00525     
00526     variable selected
00527     
00528     # If the number string is a decimal number without a preceding 'd' character, add it now
00529     if {[set d_added [regexp {^[0-9]+$} $numstr]]} { 
00530       set numstr "d$numstr"
00531     }
00532     
00533     # Parse the number string to verify that it's valid
00534     if {[regexp {^(.*)((b[0-1]*)|(d[0-9]*)|(o[0-7]*)|([xh][0-9a-fA-F]*))$} $numstr -> prefix numstr]} {
00535       
00536       # Get the cursors
00537       set mcursors [lreverse [$txt tag ranges mcursor]]
00538       
00539       # Get the last number
00540       set num_mcursors [expr ([llength $mcursors] / 2)]
00541       
00542       # If things were selected, delete their characters and re-add the multicursors
00543       if {$selected} {
00544         foreach {end start} $mcursors {
00545           $txt delete $start $end
00546           $txt tag add mcursor $start
00547         }
00548         set selected 0
00549       }
00550       
00551       # Get the number portion of the number string.  If one does not exist,
00552       # default the number to 0.
00553       if {[set num [string range $numstr 1 end]] eq ""} {
00554         set num 0
00555       }
00556       
00557       # Handle the value insertions
00558       switch [string tolower [string index $numstr 0]] {
00559         b {
00560           set num [expr 0b$num + ($num_mcursors - 1)]
00561           foreach {end start} $mcursors {
00562             set binRep [binary format c $num]
00563             binary scan $binRep B* binStr
00564             $txt insert $start [format "%s%s%s%s" $prefix [string index $numstr 0] [string trimleft [string range $binStr 0 end-1] 0] [string index $binStr end]]
00565             incr num -1
00566           }
00567         }
00568         d {
00569           set num [expr $num + ($num_mcursors - 1)]
00570           foreach {end start} $mcursors {
00571             $txt insert $start [format "%s%s%d" $prefix [expr {$d_added ? "" : [string index $numstr 0]}] $num]
00572             incr num -1
00573           }
00574         }
00575         o {
00576           set num [expr 0o$num + ($num_mcursors - 1)]
00577           foreach {end start} $mcursors {
00578             $txt insert $start [format "%s%s%o" $prefix [string index $numstr 0] $num]
00579             incr num -1
00580           }
00581         }
00582         h -
00583         x {
00584           set num [expr 0x$num + ($num_mcursors - 1)]
00585           foreach {end start} $mcursors {
00586             $txt insert $start [format "%s%s%x" $prefix [string index $numstr 0] $num]
00587             incr num -1
00588           }
00589         }
00590       }
00591       
00592       return 1
00593       
00594     }
00595     
00596     return 0
00597     
00598   }
00599   
00600   ######################################################################
00601   # Aligns all of the cursors by inserting spaces prior to each cursor
00602   # that is less than the one in the highest column position.  If multiple
00603   # cursors exist on the same line, the cursor in the lowest column position
00604   # is used.
00605   proc align {txt} {
00606     
00607     set last_row -1
00608     set max_col  0
00609     set cursors  [list]
00610     
00611     # Find the cursor position to align to and the cursors to align
00612     foreach {start end} [$txt tag ranges mcursor] {
00613       lassign [split $start .] row col
00614       if {$row ne $last_row} {
00615         set last_row $row
00616         if {$col > $max_col} {
00617           set max_col $col
00618         }
00619         lappend cursors [list $row $col]
00620       }
00621     }
00622     
00623     # Insert spaces to align all columns
00624     foreach cursor $cursors {
00625       $txt insert [join $cursor .] [string repeat " " [expr $max_col - [lindex $cursor 1]]]
00626     }
00627     
00628   }
00629   
00630   ######################################################################
00631   # Copies any multicursors found in the given text block.
00632   proc copy {txt start end} {
00633     
00634     variable copy_cursors
00635     
00636     # Current index
00637     set current $start
00638     
00639     # Initialize copy cursor information
00640     set copy_cursors($txt,offsets) [list]
00641     set copy_cursors($txt,value)   [clipboard get]
00642     
00643     # Get the mcursor offsets from start
00644     while {[set index [$txt tag nextrange mcursor $current $end]] ne ""} {
00645       lappend copy_cursors($txt,offsets) [$txt count -chars $start [lindex $index 0]]
00646       set current [$txt index "[lindex $index 0]+1c"]
00647     }
00648     
00649   }
00650   
00651   ######################################################################
00652   # Adds multicursors to the given pasted text.
00653   proc paste {txt start} {
00654     
00655     variable copy_cursors
00656     
00657     # Only perform the operation if the stored value matches the clipboard contents
00658     if {[info exists copy_cursors($txt,value)] && ($copy_cursors($txt,value) eq [clipboard get])} {
00659       
00660       # Add the mcursors
00661       foreach offset $copy_cursors($txt,offsets) {
00662         $txt tag add mcursor "$start+${offset}c"
00663       }
00664       
00665     }
00666       
00667   }
00668    
00669 }
